trustfund:
TF024852-SOCIAL SECTORS UNIT IN LA PAZ,TF024849-HUMAN RESOURCES UNIT IN LA PAZ,TF024243-BOLIVIA-EDUCATION REFORM
            PROJECT AND EDUCATION QUALITY AND EQUITY STREN,TF021434-EDUCATION QUALITY & EQUITY
            STRENGTHENING PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Quality and Equity
            Strengthening Project aims at a) providing integrated
            infrastructure and educational process improvements; b)
            increasing the participation of parents and teachers in the
            educational reform; c) strengthening the ability of the
            municipalities to plan and carry out integrated investments
            in infrastructure and educational processes; and d)
            developing new administrative mechanisms for an effective
            working relation among the Ministry of Education, the
            Municipalities and the Social Investment Fund.  There are
            five project components.  First, Municipal Educational
            Development Programs (PDEMs), the core of the project, will
            improve coverage education targets at the primary level
            through the provision of educational process inputs combined
            with infrastructure aspects as integral fashion.  The
            programs were based on proposals prepared by parents,
            teachers, and directors of school nucleus.  Second,
            institutional strengthening will provide training and
            technical assistance at the nucleus and municipal levels,
            and provide equipment for District Head Offices.  Third,
            Social Investment Fund subprojects will provide funding of
            school facilities.  Fourth, rural girls schooling will
            develop a strategy allowing for a sustained increase of
            female enrollment within the educational system in rural
            areas.  Fifth, secondary and tertiary education studies will
            support evaluation on how to expand the Education Reform
            Program to secondary and tertiary education.
